results.title: Encouragement and growth
results.brief_description:
A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Against the Grain” in association with Partners in Grain (PING).
Education was always a focus in Nickie Berrisford’s life. In this story Nickie tells of her upbringing, her marriage to a Horsham farmer, rural life and her four children. She openly speaks of her role as an educator, wife, and mother, and of her fourth child Laura who was born with Down Syndrome. Nickie has also been a mentor - encouraging, challenging and supporting the other women in the grain industry. This is her tribute to family, friends and bonds that have been formed, hopefully never to be broken.

results.title: Swimming and diving
results.creator_credit: Denis Phelan, James Murray, Big Fights Olympic Library, UP Sports and Golden Years
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Olympic glory: the golden years”.
A history of the modern Olympic Games which utilises archival media footage to illustrate some of the heroic achievements of Olympic swimmers and divers. This tape includes footage; the springboard diving win of Pat McCormick in 1956; the Gold Medal wins of Shane Gould, Dawn Fraser and Murray Rose.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Denis Phelan, James Murray, Big Fights Olympic Library, UP Sports and Golden Years

results.title: Olympic glory: the golden years
results.creator_credit: Denis Phelan, James Murray, Big Fights Olympic Library, Video Sports and Golden Years
results.brief_description: This series captures the golden years of Olympic competition where heroes like Dawn Fraser, Betty Cuthbert, Jesse Owens and Mark Spitz became legends of the Olympic spirit. Rare archival footage, narrated by Norman May, makes this a must for sports history lovers.

results.title: Heroes, heartbreaks and hilarities
results.creator_credit: Denis Phelan, James Murray, Big Fights Olympic Library and Golden Years
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Olympic glory: the golden years”.
The Olympic tradition has not only fostered great sporting champions, it has created immortal images of heroic proportions. Legends such as Johnny Weissmuller, Emil Zatopek, Ron Clarke and many others have become household names, their personalities taking over where sporting achievement leaves off. This is their story - a story of heroes and heartbreak - where athletes are pushed to breaking point and beyond in the struggle for Olympic glory. It is also a look at the lighter side of the Olympic personality and the truth behind the iron-clad determination athletes must present in the heat of competition! Production is based on the “Big Fights Olympic Library”.

results.title: The Melbourne Games
results.creator_credit: Denis Phelan, James Murray, Video Sports and Golden Years
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Olympic glory: the golden years”.
Live through the unforgettable action for the first time the Olympic Flame blazed in the Southern Hemisphere. This program captures the momentous highs and lows Australians were able to savour first hand. It includes footage of the remarkable first, second and third places captured by Australian swimmers in the women’s 100m final, headed by the fabulous Dawn Fraser. The explosive confrontation between Hungarian and Russian water polo teams, less than three weeks after the Russian invasion. The pride of Betty Cuthbert’s glorious wins in the 100m, 200m and 4 x 100m relay races. Plus all the local magic of a youthful nation hosting the world’s premiere sporting competition. Narrated by Norman May.

results.title: Sweet Charity
results.creator_credit: Bob Fosse, Robert Arthur and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Charity Hope Valentine (Shirley MacLaine) works as an erotic dancer and sometimes prostitute and is constantly unlucky in love. Whatever the disasters in her lovelife, she compensates with a rich fantasy life in which she dreams of meeting a man who will take her away from the sleazy world of the dancehalls. Based on a stage musical scripted by Neil Simon, which in turn was based on Federico Fellini’s “Nights of Cabiria.” “Sweet Charity” is a highly enjoyable screen musical which points to the new direction the musical film was to take in the ‘70’s. Fosse maintains the Broadway plot but he choreographs a stunning series of dance routines around the songs “Big Spender”, “There’s Got to be Something Better than This”, “If My Friends Could See Me Now” and a wonderfully hippie version of “Rhythm of Life” sung by a New Age minister played by Sammy Davis Jr. In “Sweet Charity” Bob Fosse is beginning the experimentation with dance and music which was to lead to his groundbreaking work in “Cabaret.”
